intro: Hedysarum salicifolium, commonly known as the willow-leaf peavine, is a flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of the western United States and is characterized by its willow-like leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has a climbing habit and produces pods that contain small, edible seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. Hedysarum salicifolium plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for pollinators.
